content: **the pattern is also available to buy as a hobbii plus design here 1 ** this pattern is one of my favourites as i designed it for my sister s baby girl * who s due in any minute as i write this * as a unique gift i wanted to make something quick yet beautifully textured but not too holey she loves pastel and soft shades so the yarn cake i had in my stash was perfect for it some of you might remember these stitches as they were used in anna s tales cal-part 3 2 i ve just done some alterations so i was able to start it from the middle **as this is a simple 2 row pattern repeat you can stop at any time and make it as big or small as you like ** the pattern is **free on my blog here 3 ** or if you click on visit pattern website above **finished size ** 100 cm x 100 cm / 39 x 39 **materials needed ** 3 75 mm f size hook i used furls alpha series-blackwood 2 scheepjes whirls or approximately 2188 yards/2000 meters of fingering weight yarn i used scheepjes whirl in popin candy yarn needle for weaving in ends scissors stitch markers optional **note blocking is essential to enhance the textured patternwork of your blanket** **us terms** used throughout it is available to download as a **photo tutorial** and it has a **print friendly version too** **this is a written pattern only with no chart** i hope you will love this pattern as much as i loved creating it ***happy crocheting *** *krisztina* 1 https //hobbii mvk co/2sdyg 2 https //www ravelry com/patterns/library/annas-tales 3 https //kamecrochet com/2021/07/11/aina-blanket/
